etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Nature: a weekly journal of science. From German Augen, specific use of the plural of Auge eye

definitions: Flattened oval or lens-shaped mineral grains present in some metamorphic rocks, notably augen-gneiss. Chiefly attributive, indicating the presence of such grains, as "augen-schist", "augen structure", etc.
